page.title: 01OWSLEBURY CUB HUT
page.content: The two huts were built so that the cubs and scouts would have a place to store their equipment.The builder was Mr.J.Merritt with the help of Mrs. Merritt,Mr. Weeks and Mr.P.Allen.It took three years to build. The cub huts were dismantled in Winchester and brought to Owslebury by Mr Gough and rebuilt. The cub huts are used by cubs, visiting cubs and brownies. The huts are made of wood with an asbestos roof and concrete floors. In olden days, the cub huts were sometimes used by the council. When it was first built all scouts and cubs wore shorts,socks to the knees, kakhi shirts and berets. The past leaders have been Mr Merritt, Mr Williams, Mr Johnson, Mrs Weeks, Mr Allen, Mr Smith and Mr Holmes.
